description: See Satan: from Latin Satān, from Ancient Greek Σατάν (Satán), from Hebrew שָׂטָן‎ (Sātān, “adversary, accuser”).

entries.meaning: Alternative form of Satan (especially in the sense "a demon follower of Satan; a fallen angel").
examples: According to Wahb b. Munnabih, Muhammad b. Ka‘b, and other authorities: Solomon was led to this [test of her intelligence] because the satans feared that he would marry her and make her desirous of having his offspring. She would then disclose to him the secrets of the jinn, and they would never rid themselves of their subservience to Solomon and his offspring to follow.
